concept.title: AI_TORUS Command
concept.shortdesc: Creates a 3D polygon mesh in the shape of a torus.

conbody.p: Create a 3D polygon mesh in the shape of a torus. Choose from a combination of options including center and radius or diameter of both the whole torus and the body of the torus.

section.title: Methods to create a torus
section.p: There is one method to begin creating a torus:

dlentry.dd: Begin creating a torus by specifying its center then:
Specify the overall radius of the torus. The radius is measured from the center of the whole torus to the outer edge of the body (tube) of the torus.

dlentry.dt: Set radius of body of torus
dlentry.dd: Specify the radius of the body (tube) of the torus.
Specify the number of isolines, perpendicular to the xy-plane, used to simulate the toruss curved surface. The default is 16.
Specify the number of isolines, parallel to the xy-plane, used to simulate the toruss curved surface. The default is 16.

section.title: Option within the AI_TORUS command
section.p: After you begin creating a torus, the following option may be available:

dlentry.dd: Specify the diameter of the whole torus. The diameter is twice the distance from the center of the whole torus to the outer edge of the body (tube) of the torus.
Specify the diameter of the body of the torus.
